## GAD-7 vs GHQ-30: A Harmony-Driven Comparison

Comparing psychological assessment scales such as the GAD-7 and GHQ-30 can be a daunting task due to the nuanced and context-specific language used in these tools. Fortunately, with Harmony, psychologists and researchers can conduct this harmonization process with ease and accuracy. Harmony is a state-of-the-art software that utilizes natural language processing and generative AI models to match assessment items, even in different languages.


## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and GHQ-30

We have a distinctive approach for GAD-7 vs GHQ-30 comparison. Harmony allows for a two-fold comparison of both GAD-7 and GHQ-30. For one, it can compare instruments by giving a percentage match between each item in the two questionnaires. This feature proves invaluable for researchers who can select from Harmony's extensive database or even upload their own assessments in PDF form. Utilizing Harmony in a GAD-7 vs GHQ-30 analysis ensures a more objective and time-saving approach to harmonizing questionnaire items.

{{< youtube cEZppTBj1NI >}}



Harmony can do more than just compare English language instruments such as GAD-7 and GHQ-30. Having the ability to analyse in multiple languages, Harmony's utility is exceptionally vital in cross-cultural or multi-national studies where the same questionnaire is linguistically adapted. With this, the GAD-7 vs GHQ-30 analysis can explore cultural implications of anxiety disorder presentations, ultimately leading to more inclusive and representative research findings.


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
